titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Presbyterian Union of Cleveland, Ohio, was formed with the object of promoting Presbyterian Church extension in the city of Cleveland. The Union's members were pastors, elders, deacons, and selected church members. Churches represented included Westminster Chapel, North Church, Euclid Avenue Presbyterian, Woodland Avenue Church, First Presbyterian, Second Presbyterian, Case Avenue Church, and others.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of minutes of the Presbyterian Union of Cleveland. Minutes include reports on attendance and the size and health of congregations; discussions about donations and raising of funds; proposals for the establishment of new churches; and treasurer's reports and reports of annual meetings, and articles of association.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
